alert.note: Alert for Carter; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Love; Marshall; Murray; Pontotoc; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 4:30AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Johnston, northeastern Love, northwestern Coal, southern Seminole, southeastern Carter, Pontotoc, northwestern Marshall, eastern Murray and northwestern Hughes Counties through 500 AM CST... At 430 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Fittstown to 3 miles west of Mill Creek to 3 miles southwest of Dickson. Movement was northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Ada, Holdenville, Sulphur, Madill, Tishomingo, Wewoka, Dickson, Byng, Allen, Mannsville, Roff, Springer, Ravia, Stonewall, Mill Creek, Francis, Calvin, Fitzhugh and Dougherty. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 26 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Carter; Coal; Hughes; Johnston; Love; Marshall; Murray; Pontotoc; Seminole
